Floating Shapes Animation – CSS Background Effect
elements.description:
Create a mesmerizing floating shapes background using HTML & CSS animations! 🚀 This project features animated squares and circles rising with a smooth transition, creating a modern and aesthetic visual effect. Perfect for website backgrounds, landing pages, or interactive designs!

✨ Features:
✅ Floating animated elements
✅ Customizable shapes & speeds
✅ Smooth CSS animations

💡 Try this effect to enhance your web projects! 🌊

#HTML #CSS #Animation #BackgroundDesign #WebDev

elements.title: Seamless Geometric Pattern Background using Pure CSS
elements.description: Create a beautiful seamless geometric pattern background using only CSS. This design features a repeating hexagonal tile effect with smooth gradients and precise positioning, giving it a modern and aesthetic look. Perfect for website backgrounds, UI elements, or creative web designs. The pattern is fully responsive and does not require images, making it lightweight and efficient.
elements.css:
body {
  background:
    43.3px 50px/86.6px 150px radial-gradient(1% 66% at 0 100%, tan 99%, transparent 0),
    43.3px 100px/86.6px 150px radial-gradient(1% 66% at 100% 0, tan 99%, transparent 0),
    0 25px/86.6px 150px radial-gradient(1% 66% at 100% 0, tan 99%, transparent 0),
    0 125px/86.6px 150px radial-gradient(1% 66% at 0 100%, tan 99%, transparent 0),
    0 100px/86.6px 150px linear-gradient(30deg, white 2.5%, tan 0 7.5%, white 0 12%, tan 0 13%, transparent 0),
    0 125px/86.6px 150px linear-gradient(30deg, white 5%, tan 0 10%, white 0 12.5%, transparent 0),
    43.3px 100px/86.6px 150px linear-gradient(210deg, white 5%, tan 0 10%, white 0 12.5%, transparent 0),
    43.3px 125px/86.6px 150px linear-gradient(210deg, white 2.5%, tan 0 7.5%, white 0 12%, tan 0 13%, transparent 0),
    43.3px 25px/86.6px 150px linear-gradient(30deg, white 2.5%, tan 0 7.5%, white 0 12%, tan 0 13%, transparent 0),
    43.3px 50px/86.6px 150px linear-gradient(30deg, white 5%, tan 0 10%, white 0 12.5%, transparent 0),
    0 25px/86.6px 150px linear-gradient(210deg, white 5%, tan 0 10%, white 0 12.5%, transparent 0),
    0 50px/86.6px 150px linear-gradient(210deg, white 2.5%, tan 0 7.5%, white 0 12%, tan 0 13%, transparent 0),
    43.3px 75px/86.6px 150px linear-gradient(150deg, transparent 37%, tan 0 38%, white 0 42.5%, tan 0 47.5%, white 0 52.5%, tan 0 57.5%, white 0 62%, tan 0 63%, transparent 0),
    0 0/86.6px 150px linear-gradient(150deg, transparent 37%,tan 0 38%, white 0 42.5%, tan 0 47.5%, white 0 52.5%, tan 0 57.5%, white 0 62%, tan 0 63%, transparent 0),
    0 0/86.6px 150px linear-gradient(90deg, tan 1%, white 0 10%, tan 0 20%, white 0 30%, tan 0 40%, white 0 49%, tan 0 51%, white 0 60%, tan 0 70%, white 0 80%, tan 0 90%, white 0 99%, tan 0);
}

elements.title: 🚀 Pure CSS Animated Background | Floating Circle Animation 🌟
elements.description: This project features a pure CSS animated background with floating circles. Using keyframe animations, the circles smoothly rise and rotate while fading out, creating a dynamic visual effect. The background includes a beautiful gradient, making it perfect for website headers, portfolio designs, or creative UI elements. No JavaScript is required, making the animation lightweight and efficient.
elements.html: Pure CSS Animated Background

elements.title: CSS Bubble Animation Button | Click Effect with Smooth Bouncing Bubbles
elements.description:
🚀 Want to add an eye-catching button animation to your website? In this tutorial, we’ll create a bubble burst effect when clicking a button using pure CSS and JavaScript! 🎨💡

✨ What’s Inside?
✅ Smooth Bubble Animation using @keyframes
✅ Radial Gradient Effects for a glowing look
✅ CSS Transitions & Transformations for a natural feel
✅ JavaScript Click Event to trigger the effect

🔗 Perfect for: Buttons, UI enhancements, creative animations!

💻 No libraries, just HTML, CSS & JavaScript! Let’s make your UI pop! 🎉

#CSS #ButtonAnimation #WebDesign #UIUX #JavaScriptEffects

elements.title: 🔢 Simple JavaScript Calculator for Beginners – HTML, CSS & JS 💡
elements.description: This is a simple JavaScript-powered calculator built with HTML, CSS, and JS. It supports basic arithmetic operations (+, -, ×, ÷), percentage, and negation with a clean, responsive UI. Perfect for beginners to learn event handling, DOM manipulation, and dynamic button creation in JavaScript.

elements.title: 2048 Game – Merge Tiles & Score High!
elements.description: Enjoy the classic 2048 game in a smooth and responsive layout. Swipe to merge tiles and reach 2048 while keeping track of your score. Works seamlessly across all screen sizes!

elements.title: 🎯 Build a Sudoku Game with JavaScript – Interactive & Fun! 🧩✨
elements.description: 🚀 Learn how to create a fully functional Sudoku game using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript! In this tutorial, we'll build an interactive 9x9 Sudoku board with number selection, error tracking, and real-time validation. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced developer, this project will enhance your skills in DOM manipulation, event handling, and grid-based layouts.

elements.title: Build a Secure Password Generator with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
elements.description: In this project, we’ll create a Password Generator using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. This tool allows users to generate secure passwords based on their preferences, such as password length and character types (lowercase, uppercase, numbers, and symbols). The generated password can be copied to the clipboard with a single click. This project is perfect for beginners looking to practice DOM manipulation, event handling, and basic styling.

elements.title: 🚀 Build a Simple Calculator with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript! 🎯
elements.description:
I just built a clean and functional calculator using only HTML, CSS, and JavaScript! 🖥️✨ It features a simple UI design, click-responsive buttons, and supports basic math operations ➕➖✖️➗. Check it out and let me know what you think! 🚀

#HTML #CSS #JavaScript #WebDevelopment #Coding #Calculator #Frontend
elements.html: Calculator

elements.title: 🔥 Stunning CSS Casio Calculator UI – Clean & Improved Design! 🎨✨
elements.description: This CSS calculator UI features a clean and modern design while maintaining its unique shape! 🎯💡 The updated version improves the interface's structure, responsiveness, and visual appeal.

elements.title: 🎨 Dynamic Pixel Grid Animation – A Colorful Canvas with JavaScript & CSS! ✨
elements.description: This animated pixel grid brings a stunning randomized color effect to the screen! 🌈✨ Using JavaScript and the HTML5 Canvas API, this project dynamically generates smooth, colorful pixel transitions that respond to window resizing.

elements.title: 3D Spinning Dice Animation using HTML & CSS 🎲✨
elements.description: Want to create a realistic 3D dice animation with just HTML & CSS? 🎲🚀 In this tutorial, we build a spinning dice that smoothly rotates along the Y-axis, giving it an immersive 3D effect. Using CSS Grid, keyframe animations, and lighting effects, this project simulates a rolling die with all six sides beautifully designed!

elements.title: CSS Loader Animation | Unique Spinning Glow Effect! 🚀✨
elements.description: Want to create a smooth and unique CSS loader animation? 🚀 In this tutorial, I'll show you how to design a spinning geometric glow effect using just HTML and CSS! No JavaScript needed! 🔥

elements.title: CSS Path Animation | Smooth Moving Objects Along a Custom Path! 🚀✨
elements.description: Want to animate objects along a custom path using pure CSS? 🎯 In this tutorial, I'll show you how to create a smooth looping animation where images follow a predefined SVG path—all without JavaScript! 🚀

elements.title: text fill animation gradient colored
elements.html:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" version="1.1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" width="100%"
    height="100%">

    <!-- Background -->
    <rect x="0" y="0" fill="#222" width="100%" height="100%" />

    <!-- Text using the #pattern in defs as the fill -->
    <text x="50%" text-anchor="middle" y="50%" dy="0.4em" fill="url(#pattern)" font-family="sonos-logoregular"
        font-size="50vh">Darma</text>

    <defs>
        <!-- Da gradient -->
        <linearGradient id="gradient" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0">
            <stop offset="0%" style="stop-color:#33235b;" />
            <stop offset="25%" style="stop-color:#D62229;" />
            <stop offset="50%" style="stop-color:#E97639;" />
            <stop offset="75%" style="stop-color:#792042;" />
            <stop offset="100%" style="stop-color:#33235b;" />
        </linearGradient>

        <!-- Stitch 2 gradients together for seamless animation  -->
        <pattern id="pattern" x="0" y="0" width="300%" height="100%" patternUnits="userSpaceOnUse">
            <rect x="0" y="0" width="150%" height="100%" fill="url(#gradient)">
                <animate attributeType="XML" attributeName="x" from="0" to="150%" dur="7s" repeatCount="indefinite" />
            </rect>
            <rect x="-150%" y="0" width="150%" height="100%" fill="url(#gradient)">
                <animate attributeType="XML" attributeName="x" from="-150%" to="0" dur="7s" repeatCount="indefinite" />
            </rect>
        </pattern>

        <!-- Pull in font -->
        <!-- Copied from: https://static.sonos.com/v1/fonts/logo/sonos-logo-regular-webfont.svg -->
        <font horiz-adv-x="1024">
            <font-face font-family="sonos-logoregular" units-per-em="2048" ascent="1920" descent="-128" />
            <missing-glyph horiz-adv-x="500" />
            <glyph unicode="" horiz-adv-x="682" />
            <glyph unicode=" " />
            <glyph unicode="N" horiz-adv-x="812" d="M0 412h150v636l662 -664v1000h-148v-640l-664 664v-996z" />
            <glyph unicode="O" horiz-adv-x="1946"
                d="M470 896q0 210 150 364q148 148 362 148t362 -148q150 -154 150 -364q0 -212 -150 -362t-362 -150t-362 150t-150 362zM620 896q0 -152 106 -258q104 -108 256 -108q154 0 256 108q108 108 108 258q0 148 -108 260q-104 108 -256 108q-148 0 -256 -108 q-106 -110 -106 -260z" />
            <glyph unicode="S" horiz-adv-x="674"
                d="M0 1124q0 -58 26 -110q28 -52 80 -90q32 -26 86 -52q68 -30 124 -46q124 -40 174 -84q34 -30 34 -74q0 -52 -48 -92q-56 -42 -138 -42q-62 0 -122 26q-38 16 -72 40l-118 -80q0 -4 24 -24q24 -24 60 -46q108 -66 228 -66q70 0 132 22q66 24 108 62q44 38 72 92 q24 54 24 110q0 54 -26 110q-28 52 -78 90q-34 28 -88 52q-38 18 -122 46q-122 36 -174 82q-36 32 -36 74q0 54 50 92q54 44 138 44q60 0 120 -26q32 -12 72 -40l120 80q-2 0 -24 24q-18 18 -62 46q-104 64 -226 64q-74 0 -132 -20t-110 -62q-48 -44 -70 -92 q-26 -56 -26 -110z" />
            <glyph unicode=" " />
            <glyph unicode=" " horiz-adv-x="704" />
            <glyph unicode=" " horiz-adv-x="1408" />
            <glyph unicode=" " horiz-adv-x="704" />
            <glyph unicode=" " horiz-adv-x="1408" />
            <glyph unicode=" " horiz-adv-x="469" />

        </font>

</svg>
